chargeHist.descr: Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine
Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine

result.execSummary:
The defendant Gregory J Gale was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain fulltime employment, schooling, or combination of the two, if not must perform 10 hours community service per week.
Maintain absolute sobriety except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with agent's authorization.

Assessment, counseling, and treatment as deemed appropriate by the dept.
21 days jail credit if revoked.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been faxed to the probation office.

ADDRESS INFO for Gregory J Gale
Current: PO Box 05911, C/O Milwaukee Secure Detention Fac, Milwaukee, WI 53205-0911 United States  (Effective: 07-28-2015)
Prior: 1114 S. 14th Avenue, Wausau, WI 54401
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 9:40 am 
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo; Def appears in person with Atty Kat Jackan.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. 

State moves to: 
Ct. 1 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine/PTAC/2nd and Subsequent Offense)>>D&RI. 
Ct. 2 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine/PTAC/2nd and Subsequent Offense)>>D&RI. 
Ct. 4 (Resisting or Obstructing an Officer)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above.

PLEA: Ct. 3 (Possession of Methamphetamine/PTAC)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 
Atty Jackan makes statement. Def makes statement. 

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 2 years probation - CONDITIONS: Assessment/counseling/treatment as deemed appropriate by the dept; maintain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 or if not, perform 10 hours community service per week; maintain absolute sobriety except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with agent's authorization; AODA; payment of court costs. 
COURT finds def is entitled to 21 days jail credit if revoked.
